description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Marie Haynes April 4, 2017 Do We Still Need to Disavow in the Era of Penguin 4.0? Link Building | Search Engines Should we still be using the disavow tool? Six months after Penguin 4.0's long-awaited rollout, Marie Haynes tackles the eternal question, how to deal with link spam going forward, and whether or not you should reavow any currently disavowed links. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin March 17, 2017 Ranking Multiple Domains to Own More SERP Real Estate Search Engines | Whiteboard Friday Should you rank one site higher in a single position frequently, or own more of the SERP real estate consistently with multiple domains? In this Whiteboard Friday, Rand presents 4 questions you should ask to determine whether this strategy could work for you. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin March 14, 2017 The State of Searcher Behavior Revealed Through 23 Remarkable Statistics Search Engines | Marketing Industry | Advanced SEO How many words are in the average query? What percent of queries are phrased as questions? Are people really starting more searches on YouTube than Bing? Rand uses clickstream data to answer all the questions about searcher behavior that Google doesn't provide. Read this post M By: Michael Cottam March 13, 2017 Google Algorithmic Penalties Still Happen, Post-Penguin 4.0 Technical SEO | Search Engines Penguin penalties might be a thing of the past, but link-based algorithmic penalties still exist in Google. Read this post By: Kristina Kledzik March 8, 2017 SEO Rankings Drop: A Step-by-Step Guide to Recovery Advanced SEO | Search Engines There are hundreds of things that could cause your Google organic rankings to drop. Follow this handy guide to figure out what went wrong, and what you can do about it. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 11, 2017 8 Predictions for SEO in 2017 Search Engines | Marketing Industry It's that time again friends... That time where I grade my 2016 predictions to see whether I've got the clout and foresight to get another shot in 2017. This year is gonna be really close, as I was more aggressive last year than in prior ones, so let's see where we end up, and what I've got to say for the next 12 months. Read this post By: JP Sherman January 9, 2017 SEO Has a Younger Sibling: It’s On-Site Search, and It Deserves Attention Advanced SEO | Search Engines On-site search is a lucrative opportunity for your site, but the vast majority of companies ignore it. Find out what you can do to better understand SEO's younger sibling and apply your learnings effectively. Read this post By: Gianluca Fiorelli December 19, 2016 SEO and Digital Trends in 2017 Advanced SEO | Search Engines | Marketing Industry 2016 was an intense year, especially when it came to SEO and Google in particular. Gianluca Fiorelli predicts trends for 2017 based on evidence of what we've seen come to pass. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers December 12, 2016 Goodbye News, Hello Top Stories Search Engines Last week, Google launched "Top Stories", replacing news results. What are Top Stories, who's ranking in them, and what does it signal about Google's plans for news? Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers November 10, 2016 How to Rank on Google Home Advanced SEO | Search Engines Google Home is a single-result search device, with answers driven by featured snippets. Here are six examples of how featured snippets translate into voice answers. Read this post By: Russ Jones November 7, 2016 Google's War on Data and the Clickstream Revolution Technical SEO | Search Engines | Advanced SEO SEOs rely on data more than ever, and it seems Google is obscuring, blocking, or removing it at every opportunity. But there is hope, and we call it clickstream data. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers October 13, 2016 Why Didn't You Recover from Penguin? Link Building | Search Engines The long Penguin 4.0 rollout is nearing completion. If you were unfortunate enough not to recover, here are five possible reasons why, from full-blown conspiracies to difficult truths. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin October 7, 2016 Penguin 4.0: How the Real-Time Penguin-in-the-Core-Alg Model Changes SEO Advanced SEO | Search Engines | Whiteboard Friday Penguin 4.0 has finally rolled out as a core part of Google's algorithm. In this Whiteboard Friday, Rand explains Penguin's past, present, and future, offers his analysis of the rollout so far, and gives advice for going forward (hint: never link spam). Read this post By: Rand Fishkin September 30, 2016 Optimizing for RankBrain... Should We Do It? (Is It Even Possible?) Search Engines | Whiteboard Friday RankBrain is unlike any of the classic Google algorithms we've dealt with in the past. In today's Whiteboard Friday, Rand tackles the question of what RankBrain actually is and whether SEOs should (or even can) optimize for it. Read this post
